Job Controller Module¶

Module to launch and control running jobs.

Contains job_controller, job, and inherited classes. A job_controller can create and manage multiple jobs. The worker or user-side code can issue and manage jobs using the launch, poll and kill functions. Job attributes are queried to determine status. Functions are also provided to access and interrogate files in the job’s working directory.

class controller.JobController(registry=None, auto_resources=True)¶

The job_controller can create, poll and kill runnable jobs

__init__(registry=None, auto_resources=True)¶

Instantiate a new JobController instance.

A new JobController object is created with an application registry and configuration attributes

get_job(jobid)¶

Returns the job object for the supplied job ID

kill(job)¶

Kills or cancels the supplied job

launch(calc_type, num_procs=None, num_nodes=None, ranks_per_node=None, machinefile=None, app_args=None, stdout=None, stage_inout=None, test=False, hyperthreads=False)¶

Creates a new job, and either launches or schedules to launch in the job controller

The created job object is returned.

manager_poll(job)¶

Polls for a manager signal

poll(job)¶

Polls and updates the status attributes of the supplied job

set_kill_mode(signal=None, wait_and_kill=None, wait_time=None)¶

Configures the kill mode for the job_controller

class controller.BalsamJobController(registry=None, auto_resources=True)¶

Inherits from JobController and wraps the Balsam job management service

__init__(registry=None, auto_resources=True)¶

Instantiate a new BalsamJobController instance.

A new BalsamJobController object is created with an application registry and configuration attributes

get_job(jobid)¶

Returns the job object for the supplied job ID

kill(job)¶

Kills or cancels the supplied job

launch(calc_type, num_procs=None, num_nodes=None, ranks_per_node=None, machinefile=None, app_args=None, stdout=None, stage_inout=None, test=False, hyperthreads=False)¶

Creates a new job, and either launches or schedules to launch in the job controller

The created job object is returned.

manager_poll(job)¶

Polls for a manager signal

poll(job)¶

Polls and updates the status attributes of the supplied job

set_kill_mode(signal=None, wait_and_kill=None, wait_time=None)¶

Not currently implemented for BalsamJobController

class controller.Job(app=None, app_args=None, num_procs=None, num_nodes=None, ranks_per_node=None, machinefile=None, hostlist=None, workdir=None, stdout=None, workerid=None)¶

Manage the creation, configuration and status of a launchable job.

__init__(app=None, app_args=None, num_procs=None, num_nodes=None, ranks_per_node=None, machinefile=None, hostlist=None, workdir=None, stdout=None, workerid=None)¶

Instantiate a new Job instance.

A new job object is created with an id, status and configuration attributes This will normally be created by the job_controller on a launch

file_exists_in_workdir(filename)¶

Returns True if the named file exists in the job’s workdir, else False

read_file_in_workdir(filename)¶

Open and reads the named file in the job’s workdir

read_stdout()¶

Open and reads the job’s stdout file in the job’s workdir

stdout_exists()¶

Returns True if the job’s stdout file exists in the workdir, else False

workdir_exists()¶

Returns True if the job’s workdir exists, else False

class controller.BalsamJob(app=None, app_args=None, num_procs=None, num_nodes=None, ranks_per_node=None, machinefile=None, hostlist=None, workdir=None, stdout=None, workerid=None)¶

Wraps a Balsam Job from the Balsam service.

__init__(app=None, app_args=None, num_procs=None, num_nodes=None, ranks_per_node=None, machinefile=None, hostlist=None, workdir=None, stdout=None, workerid=None)¶

A new BalsamJob object is created with an id, status and configuration attributes This will normally be created by the job_controller on a launch

file_exists_in_workdir(filename)¶

Returns True if the named file exists in the job’s workdir, else False

Returns True if the job’s stdout file exists in the workdir, else False

workdir_exists()¶

Returns True if the job’s workdir exists, else False
